Description: Fragment of wall of Attic black-figured pottery closed vase; reserved inside. Outside, a chariot scene: rump and part of tail of branded horse in foreground; reins behind; in background, female in patterned peplos, white for her arm, facing right, and perhaps a second figure to the right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 94 no. 325 pl. 70)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1995)
